Fields.DialogueText: *RATATATAT*
Hold steadfast! Don't give them an inch!
Step aside, Captain. Before you hurt yourself.
Astoria! I'm no aging pensioner!
Leave the rest to me. I'll collect my service fee after the job is done. Don't say I never do anything for you. *wink*
@BATTLE
Good work as usual, Astoria. Although I could do without the lip service next time.
Don't play coy with me, Captain. Some men would pay a hefty price for one of my tongue lashings. Besides, there's a reason I'm known as "Nasty Asty."

Fields.MenuText: Is that some kind of pet name the crew gave to you?

Fields.DialogueText: I, for one, am baffled by it. I'm nothing but nice to my subordinates. If some of them don't understand the concept of "tough love," then that's their problem.

Fields.MenuText: Are you insulted?

Fields.DialogueText: So long as my subordinates do their job, follow my orders, and keep their nicknames to themselves, I couldn't care less how they refer to me in their free time.

Fields.MenuText: You seem perfectly nice to me.

Fields.DialogueText: You see what I want you to see, Captain. I have to keep YOU of all people sweet, don't I? Should I be thrown overboard, you would surely squander my savings on something too practical.
I don't think you're all that bad.
Regardless, that's all for today, Asty. Good work.
Hm... For some reason, when you refer to me that way, I feel the lowermost pits of my stomach start to boil. Strange...
You wanted to see me, Captain?
Yes, please have a seat. We've received word of our next mission.
I'm all ears.
We've been asked to investigate five patches of water said to be overrun with Morganas.
Ugh! The way those harridans breed... it's mitosis, I tell you.
We can take out as many as we can, but the primary objective is to gather and record data on their numbers for future attacks.
That makes sense. Like I said, it would be better to eliminate them all at once than risk several escaping.
Well, as far as recon goes... they were understandably light on detail, but I was told to expect minimal aid if we overcommitted.
Typical fat cats stuck behind their desk. You'll forgive me for not taking any of their orders too seriously.

Fields.MenuText: What do you think?

Fields.DialogueText: The phrase "suicide mission" springs to mind...

Fields.MenuText: Are you prepared to undertake such a mission?

Fields.DialogueText: I am. The crew might need some convincing, but leave that to me. *wink*

Fields.MenuText: I'm starting to understand your dislike of authority figures.

Fields.DialogueText: Be sure to hold on to that feeling, Captain. It will spur you to do great things.
*ALARM*
We're not occupying one of those infested areas right now, are we?
No, they're still quite a ways off.
Then if you'll excuse me, I'd like to blow off some steam after receiving my death sentence.
By all means.
@BATTLE
If that's all you had to say, Captain, I'll take my leave.
Oh, Astoria... There was one more thing I forgot to mention...
Captain... Why are you looking at me like that...?
Captain?!
Whatever that section of front line looks like, we're clearly not expected to budge it.
GWAHAHAHA! Didn't think you could get rid of me that easily, did you?!
Captain... Did I hurt you? Did I do something wrong?
No?
Then why must you punish me so...?
Chin up, girlie. After you rescued me, I told my superiors I wouldn't mind working with you again and here we are! Call me Garth.
I'm not usually one for regret, but...
Didn't you promise Astoria you would retire?
There's a war on. It's going to take a while for that to be processed. In the meantime, I still have to put food on the table!
I'm sure you could survive a winter or two subsisting on whatever rations are stored in that gut...

Fields.MenuText: Astoria? You're looking a little green...

Fields.DialogueText: Forgive me, Captain. I must be feeling a little seasick.
We're on land...

Fields.MenuText: Can you two play nice?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm nothing but nice, Captain! You know that. *wink*

Fields.MenuText: So, Garth, do you plan on breaking your promise?

Fields.DialogueText: Heavens, no! What kind of man do you think I am?! I'll retire after this war is said and done.
Anyway, that's enough nattering, don't you think? I'm famished. Lay the table for me, would you. I'll hop aboard. Oh, and best take care of those encroaching Morganas lest they ruin my appetite!
This is going to be a long war...
We reap the seeds we sow, Captain. Now, we're stuck taking care of a lumbering watermelon...
@BATTLE
Must you eat so voraciously?
If you don't like it, there's the door.
A bat? No, too messy. Fire? I could burn myself...
Ha! Muse all you want. You don't have the gall to kill me off!

Fields.MenuText: Must you provoke her?

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing like a good sparring session early in the morning!

Fields.MenuText: I thought you two made amends?

Fields.DialogueText: Last I recall, she insulted everything I stand for before leaving me in the dust!

Fields.MenuText: Can you at least try to get along with her?

Fields.DialogueText: I can certainly try. Although I try every day to lose weight and save my money, but I've yet to be able to do so!
Honestly... Is this any way to act in the presence of someone you love?
Love?
I told the Captain here I was hot for you. What do you say, Princess? Want me to rock your world?
(Oh, sweet Lord, what have I done...)
Astoria?
I'm flattered, but I don't do relationships.
*ALARM*
If that's all, I'd best attend to the Morganas.
Astoria, wait--!
Did she seem a little off to you?
... Must be your imagination. Eat your food, Garth...
@BATTLE
We should gather supplies for the mission ahead, Captain.
Good thinking.
I've drawn up a list of everything that may come in handy during our expedition. Truthfully, a lot of what we need now is additional food rations.
Garth certainly knows how to put it away...
While we're here, Captain. How would you feel about upgrading our weaponry?

Fields.MenuText: It may prove useful in a do-or-die situation.
We're tasked with a reconnaissance mission. We shouldn't overextend ourselves.

Fields.DialogueText: You should listen to me more often, Captain. You'll learn quickly that I'm not just a pretty face. *wink*
Hmph! Don't say I didn't warn you.
Are you two nearly finished?! We have company! Hurry and make yourselves useful!
We'll be right there...
Push him into the sea? We could easily make it look like an accident. Decisions, decisions...
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: At least he can't eat metal.

Fields.DialogueText: But just imagine if he could. Probably would give Bluebonnet some competition.
We're about to reach our first destination. Stay sharp, everyone.
You weren't lying, Captain. I can see the silhouette of several ships in the distance.

Fields.MenuText: Remember, we aren't to engage in unnecessary combat.

Fields.DialogueText: Rest assured, Captain. I am not one to risk my life or anyone else's trying to be a hero.

Fields.MenuText: Keep quiet and we should remain undetected.

Fields.DialogueText: Worry not, Captain. I'm fairly familiar with all forms of espionage.

Fields.MenuText: We can't take them all on by ourselves.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm in no rush to meet my maker either. Let's stick to the plan.
GWAHAHA, I'm absolutely stuffed! Say, any more wine on deck, old chums?
Garth, keep your voice--
It's too late, Captain! We've been spotted!
Damn it all! We got what we came for. Cover fire for our retreat!
Aye-aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
IT'S GONE! IT'S ALL GONE!
Garth? Calm down, man, what's gotten into you?
The food I had stashed in my room! Some thieving demon has stolen it all!
Oh, really...
Captain, if you look at me so intensely, I'll start to blush. *wink*
I'll be conducting an investigation to catch this rat! Excuse me, but I won't be able to attend to my duties for some time.
Not like you ever do anyway...
What a pity, don't you think so, Captain? I suppose, in a way, he deserves it for interfering with our mission.
So, that's why you did it...
Partially. You must understand that I suffer from overwhelming boredom on a daily basis. Things like this tend to pass the time.

Fields.MenuText: How devilish.
Do you feel no remorse?

Fields.DialogueText: The world is my plaything, Captain. Surely I can do whatever I like to those who choose to live in it.
You'll have to try harder than that to flirt with me.

Fields.MenuText: Why are you so bored? Is Morgana fighting not exhilirating enough?

Fields.DialogueText: Morganas sink below the waves all hue and cry, and then they're back for more of the same. Where's the fun in killing something with more than one life to lose?
From the way you speak, you sound like nothing more than a two-bit prankster.
Oho, is that how you see it, Captain? I would advise you not to underestimate me.
*ALARM*
Perhaps I should take care of these Morganas myself if it bores you so much.
I value our friendship, Captain. I'm here for the company. *wink*
@BATTLE
There are even more Morganas here than in our last area of operation...
Who knows what kind of casualties we would have faced had we not conducted this recon first.
Are you watching our six, Garth?
Huh? Yeah, yeah. You forget I used to be a captain myself, don't you?

Fields.MenuText: Are you and Garth finding some common ground yet?

Fields.DialogueText: Professionalism demands that I treat our working relationship as an... opportunity for growth.

Fields.MenuText: Try to be the bigger person, Astoria.

Fields.DialogueText: I'd rather be the richer person. He's an island in his own right.

Fields.MenuText: How do you think Garth ever became a captain?

Fields.DialogueText: I imagine a lot went on behind the scenes that we aren't privy to. Oh, to be a fly on that wall...
*KABOOM*
What the hell was--?!
From behind! Garth, you were supposed to be keeping a lookout!
Don't blame me for your own negligence!
No time to argue, Astoria! Let's get out of here before we attract too much attention!
@BATTLE
Phew, we barely made it out of that one.
You should learn to pick your battles more effectively, Captain.
You--!
Hm? Something on your mind?
... No, nothing at all. My summation of you has been right all along. I won't waste another minute being vexed by anything you do.
Good. Finally, some respect!
I would be wary, however. I'm not sure Lucifer will be as forgiving as I.
It's nice to touch land again! This pleasant breeze, rife with the smell of flowers... it's exactly what I needed!
Don't get too used to it. We'll be heading back out as soon as we resupply. I hope Garth hasn't cleared out the rations again...
I wouldn't worry about that, Captain. Take a look at that.
Hm? It looks to be just another ship.
Not just any ship, Captain. Garth's ship!
I'm lost. Garth's ship was nothing but a wreck when we rescued him.
I pulled some strings, called in a few favors, and fluttered a few eyelashes to get this top-of-the-line vessel for next to nothing.

Fields.MenuText: How exactly did you manage it?
Who exactly did you contact?
Why exactly did you feel this was necessary?

Fields.DialogueText: I can't go another minute living with that man, Captain. It had to be done.
I have little birdies everywhere, Captain. It doesn't take much effort for me to get in contact with any one of them if I need to.
I have little birdies everywhere, Captain. It doesn't take much effort for me to get in contact with any one of them if I need to.
*ALARM*
Now, I'll deal with those Morganas, so please deliver Garth the good news!
Remind me never to get on your bad side...
Oh, Captain... You could never! *wink*
@BATTLE
GWAHAHA! You're finally pulling your weight, girlie! She'll make for a fine vessel!
I'm glad you like her. Now, please board and never show your face in front of me again...
I think you're forgetting something. How do you expect me to pilot this ship without a crew?!
We've allotted you several trainee sailors that should prove--
No, no, no, I can't rely on a bunch of kids yet to find their sea legs! I need at least one veteran seaman aboard to keep the riff-raff in line! I'll need some of your men.
*Sigh* Very well. Please pick out who you want to join you.
Don't mind if I do.
Seeing as we'll be losing a few men, Captain, should we ask around the port town if any would-be sailors are interested in joining us?

Fields.MenuText: It seems we might have to.

Fields.DialogueText: *Sigh* I'll go make the necessary rounds...
I hope you plan on reimbursing me for the time and effort I spent training whoever he takes.
*ALARM*
How about I take care of the Morganas for you instead?
I'd sooner fight them myself...
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Yes, but let me do the talking.

Fields.DialogueText: I rather think I'm the stronger recruiter, Captain.
Yes, yes, everyone loves Belles. But I don't come at them with an indefinite-length contract.
Oh, pish-posh. You just pick the illiterates.
And that right there is why the humans are taking point on this.
Hai. Hai. Kashikomarimashita! Hai, arigatō gozaimasu.
Everything in order with our overseas informant?
He said he will continue monitoring the situation and be back in touch as soon as possible.
Color me impressed! For all the cretinous slurs that spill out of your mouth in English, you seem to have quite the grasp on Japanese! GWAHAHA!
Ignore him, Astoria.
Don't worry, I am...

Fields.MenuText: How many languages can you speak again?

Fields.DialogueText: English, Japanese, Chinese, Spanish, and Tagalog... that's five. No, six. I can bluff my way through Pennsylvania Dutch.

Fields.MenuText: Do you have a favorite language out of the several you speak?

Fields.DialogueText: Japanese, probably. I've always had a special fascination... I was the last American warship to visit before all this madness, you know. When I repatriated Ambassador Saito's ashes.
How I wish I'd been awake for that. Now, *there's* a country that knows how to get with the times.

Fields.MenuText: Despite gifting him his own ship, Garth is still here an awful lot, isn't he?

Fields.DialogueText: Did you hear that, Garth? Even the Captain is getting sick of you.
Tell you what. I'd be happy to return to my ship for a kiss on the cheek! GWAHAHA!
*ALARM*
Morganas! We should be able to dispatch them easily now that we have another ship to work with!
@BATTLE
Three areas down, two to go!
How are you holding up over there, Garth?!
Can't complain! The further we are from those Morganas the... LOOK OUT!
*KABOOM*
Another ambush!
It will take us too long to turn around!
What are you lollygagging for?! Hurry up and turn your hunk of metal around! Leave the cover fire to me and my men!
Garth...
You heard the captain! Let's get in gear!
@BATTLE
*THUD*
You guys all right over here? Looks like we managed to drive them off somehow.

Fields.MenuText: I never thought I'd see the day.
We owe you a debt, Garth.

Fields.DialogueText: Pish-posh! Consider it repayment for my earlier blunder. I may be a man of loose morals, but even I know the value of paying off one's debts.
There's a first time for everything in this world, Captain! GWAHAHA!

Fields.MenuText: You may have to help me in picking Astoria's jaw up from the floor.

Fields.DialogueText: GWAHAHA! it's nice to render the cute little loudmouth speechless once in a while!
Captain, what say we rest up for the day with a nice hearty meal?
That sounds delightful.
Assuming you'll be joining us, Garth?
GWAHAHA! You couldn't keep me away!
Eat your fill, everyone. You earned it!
You don't need to tell me twice! *Munch munch* This is incredible! Who made this?!
Thank you for the compliment.
GWAHAHA! That explains why I've fallen for you! My wife always did know how to make my stomach rumble!
You're... married?
I was. She lost her life at the hands of the Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: Tell us about her.

Fields.DialogueText: Not much to tell! She supported me from a fledgling right the way up through my induction! Surprisingly, with how good a cook she was, all this weight was put on after she passed!

Fields.MenuText: How long were you married?

Fields.DialogueText: God knows! Although she looked less than presentable by the time she eventually kicked it! Nothing like your stunning consort over here, Cap-- OW!

Fields.MenuText: I'm sorry to hear that.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't be. War doesn't play favorites, Captain. You should know that more than anyone.
You have my sympathies...
GWAHahaha... *Sigh* My heart's not in this war... My heart left me a long time ago.
We don't mean to pry...
I don't harbor hatred, regret, happiness, or hope. I've been lying to myself this entire time. I fear death not because it will mean the end of my life or the loss of my resources...
I fear death because I don't want my wife to see the man I've become...
You're a decent man, Garth. At least, when you want to be good.
*ALARM*
Go on, get out of here, you two. Leave this old man to his meal.
Come on, Astoria. We should take care of those Morganas!
Yes, Captain...
@BATTLE
GWAHAHA! You know, my wife would always say "a drinkin' ship's a sinkin' ship!" But she's not here to stop me anymore!
Your wife sounds like she loved you a lot. *chug chug*
Bah! Who knows what women are thinking! Nasty Asty here is evidence enough of that, am I right?! *Chug chug*
I see you've been speaking with the crew. *Sip sip*
Drink more, lighten up, and maybe you won't attract such nicknames!
I could drink both of you under the table if I wanted to.

Fields.MenuText: I didn't know you had a penchant for alcohol, Astoria.

Fields.DialogueText: I was the first warship to be christened with champagne after Prohibition ended. Alcohol has been in my blood since birth!

Fields.MenuText: He's just trying to get a rise out of you.

Fields.DialogueText: One of the few talents this man actually possesses.

Fields.MenuText: Aboard this ship, we don't tolerate name-calling of any--!

Fields.DialogueText: It's okay, Captain. Let the baby have his beer bottle.
My apologies. It means a lot to me that you two let this curmudgeonly old-timer live out his last few years in pleasant company.
Don't mention it... Seriously, keep your mouth shut.
GWAHAHAH! I love a fiery woman!
*chuckle*
*ALARM*
Morganas! Quickly, to your positions!
@BATTLE
What a day, huh, Captain?
You can say that again. It seems Garth is finally starting to find his place aboard this ship.
He'll get there, he'll get there.
So, I noticed you didn't tear him a new one for referring to you as "Nasty Asty" to your face.
Hm? I hadn't noticed...

Fields.MenuText: Are you really all talk?

Fields.DialogueText: Why don't you call me that name and find out?

Fields.MenuText: It does bother you, doesn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: I don't know what you're talking about.

Fields.MenuText: I could impose a moratorium on such words if it would make you happy.

Fields.DialogueText: My ship will never be a dictatorship, Captain. Freedom of speech is what allows me to work my crew to the bone without them feeling like slaves.
I can see there is a side to you that no one else can see. You're far from the ruthless tyrant you want others to see you as. You're a good person.
... You're drunk, Captain. Get some rest...
*ALARM*
Excuse me.
Did I say something wrong...?
@BATTLE
My head is swimming...
What did you put in that liquor, woman...?
Honestly, you two are pathetic!
I'm going to lie down for *hic* a while...
This will likely be our last stop before the final two scouting areas, Captain. I believe there were some upgrades you'd agreed to sign off on?

Fields.MenuText: Sure... whatever... just please stop talking...
A hangover isn't enough for me to shell out unnecessarily.

Fields.DialogueText: And here I thought I could pull a fast one on you. *wink*
I'm the luckiest Belle in the world! *wink*
*ALARM*
What is that ungodly noise?!
Let me handle the Morganas, Captain. You focus on picking up the supplies.
@BATTLE
Is it the Rapture? Damn it, I'm not presentable!

Fields.MenuText: Let me see those requisition forms.

Fields.DialogueText: All yours.
... I must still be drunk.
Possibly.
They don't *make* gold-plated gun shields.
Obviously not. I'm getting those commissioned.
No.
Well, nothing ventured, nothing indentured.
You'd have to get up pretty early for that.
Mm. I'll set my watch by it.
Are you sure this is the right place, Captain? I don't mean to question your judgment, but...
Not a Morgana in sight...
*BZZZZ*
Is this the place?
We believe so...
I see. Well, don't look a gift horse in the mouth. Let's record our findings and move out!
*BZZZZ*

Fields.MenuText: What do you think could have happened here?

Fields.DialogueText: I will admit that it's strange for our intel to have gotten it wrong, but it's not entirely impossible. War is full of surprises.

Fields.MenuText: What do you think we should do?

Fields.DialogueText: There's not much we can do. As much as I hate to admit it, we should continue with our mission and follow Garth's advice.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe it's a trap?

Fields.DialogueText: Could be... I don't particularly want to stick around to find out.
There looks to be some Morganas on the horizon. They don't seemd at all tied to our intel, though.
It doesn't bear recording. Let's dispatch them and move on.
@BATTLE
GAHHH!
What seems to be the problem, Garth?
The trade deadline is fast approaching and I can't for the life of me decide which stocks to invest in!
I'm not the one you should be talking to about that.
Astori--
No.
As cruel as ever...
*ALARM*
Leave it with me, Garth. I'll put in a good word for you.
Bless you, Captain.
@BATTLE
Ah! Welcome back! It all went--
Save it. Let me take a look at your portfolio.
By all means.
Just so you know, I'm doing this as a favor to the captain.
Whatever helps you sleep at--
*GLARE*
Proceed...
Would you make me a coffee while I look this over?
Do I look like a butler to--
*GLARE*
Of course! How do you--
Lots of cream, lots of sugar.
I'll be right back.

Fields.MenuText: How does it look?

Fields.DialogueText: This is all wrong. I'm surprised he hasn't had to sell a kidney yet, with the number of piss-poor investments he's made.

Fields.MenuText: You seem to be getting along.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't push me, Captain. I'm dangling over the edge as we speak.

Fields.MenuText: I'm impressed you can help him so effortlessly. How do you know so much about stocks?

Fields.DialogueText: Stocks are the quickest way to get rich with the lowest amount of effort - and education, to boot. How could I resist?
Do you need a hand with anything?
I'd love some help!
Great! What do you need me to--?
I'd love a bagel with my coffee. Be a doll and help Garth out. *wink*
Yes, Your Highness...
YAHOO!
Someone's happy.
Astoria, you angel! You've tripled my revenue in less than 24 hours!
Tripled? That's unheard of! How did you...?
I made a few calls. People become so wary of investing in oil liners that explode upon first contact.
But...? We're on the frontlines and I haven't seen any...
Oops. *wink*

Fields.MenuText: I had no idea the stock market was so flammable.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, it's not, Captain. By all accounts, it's iron-clad. I just happen to have a pretty good blowtorch.

Fields.MenuText: Make sure you use your powers for good and not evil.

Fields.DialogueText: Who are we to dictate such things, Captain? *wink*

Fields.MenuText: You did all of this for Garth?

Fields.DialogueText: Of course! The fact that I had stocks invested in a rival company is pure coincidence!
*ALARM*
Morganas! Hopefully these prove to be just as flammable as the stock market!
@BATTLE
This is our last stop before the final area.
So far, I would call this mission a roaring success. No casualties, no unnecessary combat, and no civil wars aboard our ship.
We've forgone several battles, but I worry that our ammunition may still be lacking. Captain, I would advise us to pick up at least one new weapon before heading out.

Fields.MenuText: I can't say no to that face.

Fields.DialogueText: You and everyone else. *wink*

Fields.MenuText: Those doe eyes can't get you everything you want.

Fields.DialogueText: You see right through me, don't you, Captain?
Astoria, a word?
For the last time, no, I won't help you become a millionaire.
Not that. I wanted to thank you. For putting up with me.
Excuse me?
I can see now that what I've been feeling all this time... it isn't love... it's respect. Gosh, I haven't felt anything in so long that I suppose I mixed up the two emotions.
Is that so?
We'll likely go our separate ways after this mission, but I wanted to let you know that I'm glad I met you and I wish you well.
... Thank you, Garth.
Oh and a word of advice from an aging old man. Tell the people you care about how you feel. Before it's too late.
*ALARM*
Are you two nearly done chatting?! We have company.
Yes, Captain. I'll be right...
Go on, girl.
There...
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Only one?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, the dollar signs sort of dampen the effect.
Now that's the attitude I like. Isn't war a splendid thing?
No. But the quicker we bring this one to an end, the better.
There's always someone to fight, Captain. You've just got to keep the initiative.
This is more like it.
This final area is teeming with Morganas! Keep a low profile.
I can't shake the anomaly that was that fourth area...

Fields.MenuText: I thought we agreed to write it off.

Fields.DialogueText: Tell that to the goose bumps running up and down my arm.

Fields.MenuText: Focus on the mission ahead.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll try my best to forget about it, Captain. You know I'm prone to grudges and retaining information.

Fields.MenuText: It isn't our job to worry.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course. Let's do what we came here to do and return with our heads held high.
*ALARM*
This is a reconnaissance mission! Why on earth is someone sounding the--!
*KABOOM*
*RATATATA*
Behind us, Captain! It's another ambush!
That's no ambush... It's the Morganas from the fourth area! They've crossed paths with these ones!
Garth, did you hear that?!
Loud and clear! I'll take on the Morganas in the front with my men. You focus on the backline!
Got it! Captain, let's move!
@BATTLE
Keep pushing them back, Captain! We're nearly there!
@BATTLE
That does it for the backline, Captain. How is Garth--?
We're overrun! Astoria! Captain! Can you hear me over there?!
If we don't act fast, he's not going to make it! Quickly, let's--!
No, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean, "no?"

Fields.DialogueText: I meant what I said.

Fields.MenuText: You don't think we can fight them?

Fields.DialogueText: We could fight them, potentially. But not without unnecessary casualties.

Fields.MenuText: We can't just leave him!

Fields.DialogueText: We can and we will.
Astoria! Captain!
I can't fight them alone, Astoria! You won't stand beside me?!
And risk the lives I have invested so much into? Captain, if we intervene, we'll be dead before we can count all the enemy carriers.
Please! Astoria!
The Morgana activity has been logged and needs to be reported. Tell me how to do that if we're dead. We move out.
We... move... out...
Captain! Astoria!
I can order you as your captain to save him.
I would rather be put in my own brig for mutiny than charge headfirst into such a reckless suicide mission.
Apologies Garth, but as a businessman, you understand what has to be done. Know that your wife will be happy to see a good man.
Captain? Are you in here?
I am.
You've been in here for a while now. I trust you aren't still hung up on what happened?

Fields.MenuText: I left a man to die while he screamed for me to help him.

Fields.DialogueText: Garth was a man of the sea who knew the risks of this mission. He should feel honored to have died in combat.

Fields.MenuText: This is no time for sarcasm, Astoria.

Fields.DialogueText: Perhaps your orders were logically correct. Maybe I'm more lily-livered than I thought. But the one thing I can't shake is your apathy to it all. Do you feel nothing for what transpired?!
*ALARM*
I think you may have gotten the wrong impression, Captain. I'll return after defeating these Morganas and explain everything.
@BATTLE
Earlier, you asked if I felt nothing for leaving Garth to die.
Showing one's true face is how they get you. The second you give an inch, they'll take a mile.
Who?! Who is this "they?!"
Everyone I've ever met. That's why I've found solace in putting up a facade.
I never know who or when someone will betray me. All I know is that it will happen eventually. It's easier if I forget who I really am. I haven't been that person in ages.

Fields.MenuText: You smiled with him!

Fields.DialogueText: As I smile with others. As I smile with you. It means nothing.

Fields.MenuText: You helped him! You bonded! I could see it!

Fields.DialogueText: Like I said, Captain. You saw what I wanted you to see.

Fields.MenuText: You aren't who I thought you were...

Fields.DialogueText: I warned you not to underestimate me.
*ALARM*
Those Morganas just won't quit today! If that's all for today, Captain, I'll take care of them and retire for the evening. Don't push yourself too hard. *wink*
@BATTLE
What a pleasant day... If only... Oh, Captain! Speak of the devil! What brings you up--?
I won't believe it.
Excuse me?
I won't believe that you are some heartless demon incapable of feeling emotions. I can't.
This again...
There is good in you, Astoria. No matter how much you may want me to fall in line like one of your other drones.
@BATTLE
Morganas! No rest for the wicked!
That's sweet of you, Captain, but I'm content with keeping our relationship purely professional if you are.

Fields.MenuText: You're in need of rescuing and I will be the one to do it.

Fields.DialogueText: You're welcome to try.

Fields.MenuText: This isn't business and it never was. Not to me at least.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm sorry for leading you on.

Fields.MenuText: I'm no sheep nor a puppet. I won't back down.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't entice me with a challenge!
You mustn’t forget that even when alone, even when with each other, I will always be wearing a mask, Captain.
Will you ever take it off?
Good business is indistinguishable from magic. And like any good magician, a businesswoman never reveals her secrets.
This ship has a spirit, Captain, and so does this country. The spirit of enterprise. You don't stay abreast of the market by shackling yourself to yesterday's tips.
What if someone promised to be with you in spite of that?
Ah, but then, dear Captain, I would be in a relationship, and I already told you…
I don't do relationships.
